author: olivier-spinelli
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
Open a .ps1 with VSCode after having installed PowerShell support.

Expected behavior
-----------------
In Explorer I still benefit of "Run wit PowerShell" in Explorer menu entry.

Actual behavior
---------------
Explorer's menu item is no more available.
Closing VSCode does not restore the expected behavior. Rebooting does.

Environment data
----------------
$PSVersionTable:
```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.14393.693
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.14393.693
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body:
Hi Olivier, this is likely an issue with VS Code itself, we don't do anything specific to change the Explorer context menu for .ps1 files.  I'd recommend filing this issue over on their GitHub repository:

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues

comments.author: olivier-spinelli
comments.body: Thanks, I will investigate a bit more and report this.

title: VSCode removes Explorer "Run wit PowerShell" menu entry.
